word.entryDescription: to get information
word.entryExample: I want to find out the answer.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: good enough or feeling well without any problems
word.entryExample: My sister's fine now, thank you.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to come to the end of
word.entryExample: The lesson finishes at 2 o'clock.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area where you burn paper or wood
word.entryExample: You mustn't make a fire in the forest.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the position of number one when we count
word.entryExample: This is my first time in Ireland.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: animals that lives in the sea with a tail or the flesh of a fish that we can eat
word.entryExample: There are a lot of fish in the sea.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 5
word.entryExample: My brother is five years old.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the way food tastes
word.entryExample: What is your favourite ice cream flavour?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the flat surface you walk on inside a building
word.entryExample: There was a beautiful old carpet on the floor in the castle.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something pretty that grows on a plant, often brightly-coloured with a pleasant smell
word.entryExample: There aren't any flowers in this garden.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: 1. to control or travel in an aircraft 2. to move through the air like a bird, insect or an aircraft
word.entryExample: 1. Horses can't fly.2. Birds fly in the sky.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: travelling in a plane
word.entryExample: Tom is scared of flying.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the things you eat
word.entryExample: The food in our school cafeteria is really great.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of your body that joins onto the end of your leg and you use for walking
word.entryExample: Kick the ball with your foot.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large ball you use to play the game of football
word.entryExample: I love playing football.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large area of trees
word.entryExample: Bears live in the forest.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: (past tense of 'to find') to discover; to see something after searching for it
word.entryExample: The prince found Cinderella.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 4
word.entryExample: Tables usually have four legs.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 14
word.entryExample: Two weeks is fourteen days.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the position of number four when we count
word.entryExample: Why is the fourth of July special in the US?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of equipment we use for keeping food at cool temperatures
word.entryExample: The eggs are in the fridge.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a person you know and like
word.entryExample: Lucy is my best friend.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small animal with smooth skin that lives in or near water and has long back legs for jumping
word.entryExample: Put the frog in the pond next to the ducks.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: starting at a particular time or place
word.entryExample: Where are you from?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something usually sweet which grows on a plant and contains seeds
word.entryExample: Eat fresh fruit everyday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a dish of different types of fruit cut into pieces and mixed together
word.entryExample: Let's put some more kiwis in our fruit salad.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: pleasure, enjoyment, or entertainment
word.entryExample: We all had good fun at the party.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is funny makes you laugh
word.entryExample: It's a very funny monkey!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the thick hair that covers the bodies of many mammals
word.entryExample: Your cat's fur is so soft!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an entertaining activity played to certain rules
word.entryExample: Would you like to play a game of chess with me?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area of grass and flowers outside a house
word.entryExample: We're playing in the garden.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: receive something
word.entryExample: I always get a nice present for my birthday from my parents.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to put your clothes on your body
word.entryExample: I get dressed then I have breakfast.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to arrive at your home
word.entryExample: I get home from school at 4 o'clock.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to take off your clothes
word.entryExample: I get undressed and change into my pyjamas before I go to bed at night.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to leave your bed after you wake up
word.entryExample: What time do you get up at the weekend?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a tall African animal with a very long neck and legs
word.entryExample: Giraffes have long necks.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to put something into someone's hands
word.entryExample: My dad often gives my mum flowers.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small container made of glass used for drinking
word.entryExample: Two glasses of lemonade, please.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something people wear over their eyes to help you see
word.entryExample: Where are my glasses?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you wear on your hands to protect them or keep them warm
word.entryExample: She needs gloves because it's cold.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a sticky substance used to join things together
word.entryExample: You need to use glue to put this plane together.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to walk or move to a place
word.entryExample: Let's go to the park and play football.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to take a car trip somewhere nice
word.entryExample: We went for a drive to the museum yesterday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to get inside your bed so you can sleep
word.entryExample: I'm going to bed, I'm very tired.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to go to a place where children learn
word.entryExample: We go to Green Wood School.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to stop being awake and start sleeping
word.entryExample: Go to sleep now, it's very late!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to walk or move to a place that is higher than where you are
word.entryExample: Let's go up that hill and look at the city from above.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: when you score a goal in football, you succeed in kicking a ball into the net
word.entryExample: Alex scores a goal!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an animal like a sheep but with straight fur and often horns, which lives on mountains or on farms
word.entryExample: Are there a lot of goats on the farm?
word.label: ydp
